body: As a side note, I'd be super curious to see if #3269 fixes this issue too.

I can only somewhat reproduce this by setting the "restart playback when source becomes active" flag. #3269 does not stop the video from restarting in this scenario (I haven't looked too deeply but I think its treating this as a scene change), but it does fix the fast forward seeking that happens in the current build for me.

If you uncheck the "restart playback when source becomes active" flag, this works as expected for me in master and #3269. Can you confirm your media source settings?

Without "Restart playback when source becomes active" the media source does not start to play in both versions (25.0.8 and nightly).

https://i.gyazo.com/1c6e8afe127082c98b3965b6a08c83de.gif

I tried with videos in .mp4 and 1 or 2 minutes long, with and without loop, hardware decoding and restart playback.

If you don't pause the video and transition when the video is running without restart playback, works properly.
The problem is start a video from pause, and also, the fast forward issue in the nightly.

Being able to do this would be great i.e. to have a replay, find an exact moment in that replay and leave it ready on pause and then transition to program when needed.

With VLC there is no problem, but you cannot take advantage of hardware decoding with VLC video source at the moment.

If https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/pull/3269 fixes this is great.

With further testing, I'm confident the video fast-forwarding is a side effect of #3235. The problem is caused by resetting a paused video that has been paused for some time. The longer the video has been paused, the longer the fast forwarding occurs. You don't even need to use scene transitions to test this. Just pause a video, wait 10 seconds, then reset it. There will be a brief fast forward. #3269 fixes that.

As for the video staying paused after a transition, I'm not sure if that's a bug or by design. If the scene transition doesn't signal a play, then I see no reason the media source would begin playing.

> #3269 fixes that.

Perfect!

> As for the video staying paused after a transition, I'm not sure if that's a bug or by design. If the scene transition doesn't signal a play, then I see no reason the media source would begin playing.

Probably by design, could be.
This makes sense with the restart playback option disabled.

With the option enabled, it seems more logical to me that the video starts playing whether it's paused at some point or starts from the beginning (not paused).

It's not really a problem for those who need to perform this function, they can do it with VLC.
But it seems better that both options (media and vlc) can work in the same way imo.

I really appreciate all your work!

issue.title: deps/media-playback: Rewrite to use queue and states

labels.name: Code Cleanup
labels.description: Non-breaking change which makes code smaller or more readable

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
Media source object is rewritten in to use states and a message queue.
 By moving to a state enumerator, the state can be guaranteed through
 each iteration of the message loop. This should greatly reduce race
 condition concerns. Also broke each message into its own function that
 can be logically modified to change behavior later.

 Additionally, a message queue is created to handle events from other
 threads. A function pointer allows new states to be added easily. The
 queue also features a bit flag to ensure any given state only appears
 once.

 Makes code more readable, will make future feature implementation
 easier, and provides a more efficient execution loop.

<!--- Please fill out the following template, which will help other contributors review your Pull Request. -->

<!--- Make sure you’ve read the contribution guidelines here: https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst -->

### Description
This PR includes two key changes to the media source file:
First, states are changed from being a bunch of flags to a discrete state enumerator. This makes it easy to understand what is happening at any given time, and makes code much more readable.
Second, events are now handled by a message queue. This queue is fairly standard, but has the unique feature of providing a flag table to ensure any given message is pushed only once. 

### Motivation and Context
Seeks to improve code readability and efficiency of media source loop.

### How Has This Been Tested?
Tested any combination of media events, and provided properties in the media source settings panel. Tested multiple sources and scenes. 

Tested with Windows 10 18363 on a AMD Ryzen 3900x.

Changes should be encapsulated to the media file, but the event signalers may be relevant to obs-ffmpeg-source if the new structure changes the logic in an unanticipated way.

### Types of changes
<!--- What types of changes does your PR introduce? Uncomment all that apply -->
<!--- - Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) -->
<!--- - New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) -->
 - Performance enhancement (non-breaking change which improves efficiency)
 - Code cleanup (non-breaking change which makes code smaller or more readable)
<!--- - Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change) -->
<!--- - Documentation (a change to documentation pages) -->

### Checklist:

<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->

- [x] I have read the [**contributing** document](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst).
- [x] My code is not on the master branch.

- [x] I have included updates to all appropriate documentation.

issue.body:
Fixes #3341 by ensuring timestamps are reset after pausing.

<!--- Please fill out the following template, which will help other contributors review your Pull Request. -->

<!--- Make sure you’ve read the contribution guidelines here: https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst -->

### Description
<!--- Describe your changes in detail. -->
<!--- If this change includes UI elements, please include screenshots. -->
Adds a reset_ts call after waiting for semaphore if the media source was paused to ensure the timestamp is properly reset.
### Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
<!--- If it fixes an open Mantis issue, or implements feature request -->
<!--- from the Ideas page, please link to the issue here. -->
fixes the fast-forward component of #3341. The other component is agreed by the issue opener to be by design, so this issue can be considered resolved with this PR.
### How Has This Been Tested?
<!--- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes. -->
<!--- Include details of your testing environment (hardware, OS version, etc.),-->
<!--- and the tests you ran, including how it may affect other areas of code. -->
Verified that other state changes still function as expected.
